--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2020/0147 b) Date of Occurrence: 31/12/2024
c) Installation Details: Minotaur Heavy - AC-7746-607 at
Regional Depot-B
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Hydraulic b) Date Component 02/01/2025
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Brake System d) Main Assembly: Station-3 Port
e) Nomenclature: Brake System Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-B
g) Part No.: HY-8366-T7 h) Sl No.: SN-6460-748
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 17/10/2022 l) Date of Removal: 01/01/2025
Pg No: 14 Ln No: 5 Pg No: 143 Ln No: 20
m) Manufacturing Agency: Zeta Systems Corp n) Date, Month & Year May 2018
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2172 Hrs / 518 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Actuator seal leakage. Malfunction reported by flight crew.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Thermal cycling induced solder joint failure in electronic assembly
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Brake System component. Functional
testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Update software to latest certified version with bug fixes
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Enhance operator training on proper usage procedures
d) Attributable Code: N1 - Defect confirmed but reason not established
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 26/01/2025 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing.
Date: 29/01/2025 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational usage reviewed. Component operated within prescribed limits. Concur with investigation outcome.
Date: 31/01/2025 Signature: Air Cmde R.K. Joshi
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 30/01/2025 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound.
Date: 31/01/2025 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
